isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 ENGINE - TROUBLESHOOTING - OPTIMIZED IDLE

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect ECM power and ground circuits and connectors as outlined in Before Troubleshooting.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Optimized Idle Safety Loop Circuit
svcsubproc.para: Insure all Safety switches are closed by setting the idle timer switch to on. Shifting the transmission to neutral, insure the cab is fully lowered. Also, insure the Idle Timer switch is closed.

table.title: Testing Optimized Idle Safety Loop Circuit

entry.para: Remove ECM connector (341). Measure resistance from harness connector, terminal H2, circuit 97AV to chassis ground.
Remove Cab Tilt Switch connector (920). Measure resistance across switch terminals with cab lowered.
Measure resistance between harness connector (341), terminal H2, circuit 97AV to (920), terminal A, circuit 97BH.
Locate open in circuits 97AV, 97BA or 97BH, then repair.
Remove neutral position switch connector (918). Measure resistance across switch terminals with transmission in neutral.
Measure resistance between Cab Tilt Switch connector (920), terminal B, circuit 97BB to (918), terminal A, circuit 97BB.
Locate open in circuit 97BB, then repair.
Remove Idle Timer Switch connector (328). Measure resistance across switch terminals with switch closed.
Measure resistance between connector (918), terminal B, circuit 97BD to (328), terminal C, circuit 97AV.
Locate open in circuit 97AV or 97BD, then repair.
Measure resistance between connector (328), terminal A, circuit 97-GE to chassis ground.
Locate open in circuit 97-GE, 97-GA, 97-G or 11-G, then repair.
Reconnect all connectors except ECM connector (341). Remove Idle Relay (482). Measure the voltage between cavity 2 and ground.
Locate short to unwanted voltage in safety circuits, then repair.
Reconnect all connectors. Optimized Idle safety circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Ignition and Idle Relay Circuits

table.title: Testing Ignition and Idle Relay Circuits

entry.para: Check fuse F10-A for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace defective fuse or circuit breaker.
Remove Ignition Relay (483). Bench test relay as outlined in Testing Relays.
Remove Ignition Relay (482). Bench test relay as outlined in Testing Relays.
Turn key on. Measure voltage to ground at (483) cavity 1, circuit 17E.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 17E or 17C to F-10.
Measure voltage to ground at (482) cavity 5, circuit 17F.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 17F.
Measure voltage to ground at (482) cavity 4, circuit 17T.
Locate cause of no or low voltage circuit in circuit 17T.
Remove 10K resistor connector (782). Measure the resistance across the resistor terminals.
Measure voltage to ground at (782) cavity B, circuit 17S.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 17S, then repair.
Measure resistance between resistor connector (782), cavity A, circuit 17R to Ignition Relay Connector (483), cavity 5, circuit 17P.
Locate open in circuit 17P or 17R, then repair.
Remove ECM connector (913). Measure resistance between (913), terminal B, circuit 17H and Ignition Relay connector (483), cavity 2.
Locate open in circuit 17H, then repair.
Measure the voltage between (913), cavity B and ground.
Locate short to unwanted voltage in circuit 17H, then repair.
Reconnect all connectors. Ignition and Idle Relay circuits check good.
Remove Heater Control Diode assembly connector (783). Bench check the diode.
Measure the voltage between connector (783), terminal A, circuit 13T and ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 13T or 13H to the Ignition Relay (462-R1).
Remove Heater Relay (463-R5). Bench test relay as outlined in Testing Relays.
Measure resistance between (783), terminal B, circuit 13TA and (463-R5), terminal 5, circuit 13TA.
Remove engine ECM connector (341). Measure the resistance between (341), cavity F3, circuit 75BB and (463-R5), terminal 4, circuit 75BB.
Locate open in circuit 75BB, then repair.
Measure the resistance between (341), cavity F3, circuit 75BB and ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 75BB, then repair.
Reconnect all connectors. Heater blower disable circuits check good.
Check fuse F10-B for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace defective fuse.
Remove Thermostat connector (910). Turn key on. Measure voltage between (910) terminal 5, circuit 75BD and ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 75BD or 13BN, then repair.
Measure resistance between (910) terminal 6, circuit 75-GE and ground.
Locate open in circuit 75-GE to G2 ground adapter (455-C), and repair.
Remove engine ECM connector (913). Measure resistance between (910) terminal 4, circuit 75BC and (913), terminal D, circuit 75BC.
Locate open in circuit 75BC, and repair.
Varying resistance with change in temp.
Reconnect all connectors. Thermostat circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Optimized Idle Active Indicator Light

table.title: Testing Optimized Idle Active Indicator Light

entry.para: Check fuse F10-A for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace defective fuse.
Remove connector (912) from the indicator light. Bench check the light.
Turn key on, and at (912) terminal A, (circuit 17K) measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 17K or 17C, then repair.
Remove engine ECM connector (914). Measure resistance between (914), terminal B, circuit 17LA and (912), terminal B, circuit 17L.
Locate open in circuits 17K or 17C, then repair.
Measure resistance between (914), terminal B, circuit 17LA and ground.
Locate short to ground in circuits 17LA or 17L, then repair.
Reconnect all connectors. Indicator light circuits check good.
Check fuse F10-A for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace defective fuse.
Remove connector (916) from the alarm. Bench check the alarm.
Turn key on, and at (916), terminal B, (circuit 17M) measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 17M or 17C, then repair.
Remove engine ECM connector (913). Measure resistance between (913), terminal A, circuit 17N and (916), terminal A, circuit 17N.
Locate open in circuit 17N, then repair.
Measure resistance between (913), terminal A, circuit 17N and ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 17N, then repair.
Reconnect all connectors. Alarm circuits check good.
